official-title.#text:
To amend the National Trails System Act to direct the Secretary of the Interior to conduct a study
			 on the feasibility of designating the Chief Standing Bear National
			 Historic Trail, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Chief Standing Bear national historic trail feasibility study

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 5(c) of the National Trails System Act

header.#text: Chief Standing Bear national historic trail

quote.#text: Chief Standing Bear Removal and Return

text.#text:
The Chief Standing Bear Trail, extending approximately 550 miles from Niobrara, Nebraska, to Ponca
			 City, Oklahoma, which follows the route taken by Chief Standing Bear and
			 the Ponca people during Federal Indian removal, and approximately 550
			 miles from Ponca City, Oklahoma, through Omaha, Nebraska, to Niobrara,
			 Nebraska, which follows the return route taken by Chief Standing Bear and
			 the Ponca people, as generally depicted on the map entitled

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be on file and available for public inspection in the
			 appropriate offices of the

shall include a determination on
			 whether the Chief Standing Bear Trail meets the criteria in
of for designation as a national historic trail.

text.#text: The feasibility study conducted pursuant to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be completed not later
			 than one year after the date of the enactment of this Act.

text.#text: The feasibility study authorized by the amendment in
